credential.helpText: Create a Service Account with a JSON private key and provide the JSON here. See Google Cloud docs for more info about creating a service account. These IAM roles are required: Compute Viewer (roles/compute.viewer), (Project) Viewer (roles/viewer), Kubernetes Engine Admin (roles/container.admin), Service Account User (roles/iam.serviceAccountUser). More info on roles can be found here.

description.cacerts: CA Certificates needed to verify the server's certificate
description.engine-install-url: Default Docker engine installation URL (for most node drivers)
description.engine-iso-url: Default OS installation URL (for vSphere driver)
description.engine-newest-version: The newest supported version of Docker at the time of this release.  A Docker version that does not satisfy supported docker range but is newer than this will be marked as untested
description.engine-supported-range: Semver range for supported Docker engine versions.  Versions which do not satisfy this range will be marked unsupported in the UI
description.ingress-ip-domain: Wildcard DNS domain to use for automatically generated Ingress hostnames. <ingress-name>.<namespace-name>.<ip address of ingress controller> will be added to the domain.
description.server-url: Default {appName} install url. Must be HTTPS. All nodes in your cluster must be able to reach this.
description.system-default-registry: Private registry to be used for all system Docker images
description.ui-index: HTML index location for the UI.

dangerZone.showLabel: I understand that I can break things by changing advanced settings.

Settings which have been customized from default settings are shown in bold.

user.detail: Standard Users can create new clusters and manage clusters and projects they have been granted access to.

manage-clusters.detail: Allows the user to manage all clusters, including ones they are not a member of.

manage-users.detail: Allows the user to create, remove, and set passwords for all Users

nodeDriver.editWarning:
Editing a node template will only affect new nodes created by a node pool; existing nodes will not be updated or replaced automatically.
If you delete nodes from a pool, new ones will be created using the new settings in the template.

rkeConfigComment.ingress:
""
"  # Currently only nginx ingress provider is supported."
"  # To disable ingress controller, set `provider: none`"
"  # To enable ingress on specific nodes, use the node_selector, eg:"
"     provider: nginx"
"     node_selector:"
"       app: ingress"
rkeConfigComment.network:
""
"  # If you are using calico on AWS"
""
"     network:"
"       plugin: calico"
"       calico_network_provider:"
"         cloud_provider: aws"
""
"  # To specify flannel interface"
""
"     network:"
"       plugin: flannel"
"       flannel_network_provider:"
"         iface: eth1"
""
"  # To specify flannel interface for canal plugin"
""
"     network:"
"       plugin: canal"
"       canal_network_provider:"
"         iface: eth1"
rkeConfigComment.services:
""
"     services:"
"       kube_api:"
"         service_cluster_ip_range: 10.43.0.0/16"
"       kube_controller:"
"         cluster_cidr: 10.42.0.0/16"
"         service_cluster_ip_range: 10.43.0.0/16"
"       kubelet:"
"         cluster_domain: cluster.local"
"         cluster_dns_server: 10.43.0.10"

telemetryOpt.label: Allow collection of anonymous statistics
telemetryOpt.subtext:
Rancher-Labs möchte anonyme Informationen über die Konfiguration Ihrer Installation sammeln, um beizutragen {appName} besser zu machen.
Ihre Daten werden nicht mit Dritten geteilt und keine Ihrer verwendeten Ressourcennamen oder Adressen gesammelt.
